name: The Old Ground

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly I must say parking is very hard to find and the hotel is next door to a school but these can be overlooked because the overall standard of the hotel so high.
reviews.title: A1

reviews.text: I travel to Ennis now and again for business mostly I stay with friends but if my girlfriend is with me we stay in a hotel.
reviews.title: Good location for exploring an old style town that has manged to hold its businesses in the centre.

reviews.text: This hotel has been by the best in Ennis for a long time, very well run and very busy but the best thing about this hotel is the food which is top class.
reviews.title: Excellent - as always

reviews.text: They have barfood, the hotel restaurant which looks a bit stuffy or the Town cafe which is fantastic.
reviews.title: Lucky discovery!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When back in Ennis I know where I will be staying anymore.
reviews.title: No 1 wedding venue in Ireland! 11/10
A great place to stay!
reviews.text: We stayed here last weekend while attending the Ennis Book Club Festival and it was just ideal. We had a lovely room with a very comfortable bed. Breakfast for us was served in the Town Hall restaurant which is part of the hotel and used for the overflow when the hotel is busy. This was communicated to us by letter the evening before. There was a very good choice for breakfast including delicious fresh plaice. Good quality fruit, bread and excellent coffee left us feeling well set up for a day of literature. I would have preferred to have had a pot of coffee rather than a cup but that's a small complaint.

Dinner was served in the main dining room and was faultless. We had beautifully presented food served by pleasant staff in a charming room . The free range duck was perfect and the chocolate dessert was simply gorgeous. Good wine fairly priced added to our satisfaction.
reviews.title: Great for shopping and meeting friends.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff throughout were helpful and friendly. If you want to sample Irish hospitality at its best then The Old Ground in Ennis is the place to go. I hope to return next year for the Festival but I would be very happy indeed if I could be back there before that.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.text: If you want to visit all the shops in Ennis this hotel has a great location. The food is great in the bar, when you have to wait for a table, that is a good sign, The hotel room (211) is very big and new decor , the view is not great but i cant imagen many rooms having a great view as the hotel is on a side street. it is a bit pricey for a single room at 80 Euro per night mid week. I love the loby area with lovely sofas to sit on and catch up with your friends. It seems as if the locals spend a bit of time in the hoel also which is great to see. i would stay here again and might even come back to Ennis just to stay here. pity there is no pool or gym ...
reviews.title: THE BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally managed to book a place in the hotel after saying we would do it for the las two years, and I have to say we were not disspointed. The staff on arrival were very welcoming, I am so sorry that I did not get the ladies name as so was extremly friendly. As a young couple and while we would not be dressed to the nines we were delighted to find that we were not treated any differant. The room was beautifull, with a stairs leading up to the main bedroom area. Plenty of space in the rooms, and funished to a tee. The only complaint i would have is that the rooms were a little too warn and they could have done with leaving a few more bisuits to nibble on with the tea and coffee..Was deligthed to see they provided us with a proper hairdryer also rather than the small ones tucked away in a drawer.. Would defianlty stay again
reviews.title: Enjoyed our Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very welcoming and pleasent staff, lovely comfortable and spacious room and fantasic meals. We stayed for 2 nights but wished it could have been longer. would recomend it to anyone anf will hopefully be back very soon. Outstanding venue to eat in also breakfast and dinner qas divine every time
reviews.title: fantastic service and enjoyable stay
Comfortable and convient
reviews.text: The old grand hotel is that. Grand! The staff is very, very helpful and accommodating. Rooms are a good size and the beds are really comfortable. Food is good. From breakfast through dinner it is fresh and tasty. The only down side is there was a lot of street noise in my room location. I also has an option of hanging out at the lobby. Cozy couches and tea! Overall I would come back in a heartbeat! Thank you Old Grand!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The perfect spot to stay!! We loved it. The staff, the location, the hotel and especially the food!!! It’s a must. Yes it’s a wee bit dated but for me this was part of its charm and the turf fire in the lobby just added to it. One thing I was worried about was the shower/bath, not very safe it needs more handles to old onto whilst getting in and out. My partner slipped and luckily no real damage done except their pride was hurt. There are at the moment some great mid wee deals and we stayed a little longer and they struck a deal with us into the weekend. It was one of the best breaks we had in a long time. We’ll be back!!
reviews.title: This is a must

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please try The Town Hall restaurant attached it is just a treasure, The food is at the highest end of the market.
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel, great breakfast, fantastic staff

reviews.text: First off the Old Ground is a lovely hotel great location and the food in the Restaurant and Bar is fabulous
reviews.title: Bad experience in good hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here Saturday 2nd Feb and there was the All Ireland Darts competition on in Ennis that weekend so the hotel was fully booked
reviews.title: Shines like a beacon

reviews.text: The residents bar stayed open till round 6am and people were drinking in the lobby till all hours
reviews.title: Can't write enough good things!!!

reviews.text: As we were staying in a room above the main door guests were going out smoking here half the night making a lot of drunken noise and kept us and our 3 kids wide awake all night there were people going up and down the corridors all night banging doors and in the rooms there were parties we could hear everything
reviews.title: An excellent weekend break

reviews.text: On check out i handed in my 2 key cards and wasn't asked how our stay was
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel, excellent food!

description: The Old Ground Hotel is an ideal choice as a touring base, its eclectic exterior prompts elegance and style, conveniently located in the heart of Ennis. With 83 newly refurbished deluxe rooms, a restaurant with superb cuisine, and lounge, and within easy reach of magnificent and challenging golf courses. The Old Ground Hotel is an elegant and stylish retreat.
